full.name: Full
full.description: Fully supports all features of this OCPS version.

partial.name: Partial
partial.description: Supports some, but not all, features of this version. See Notes.

none.name: None
none.description: Does not support the key features of this version.

na.name: N/A
na.description: Not Applicable, as the system uses a fundamentally different syntax.

items.name: POSIX `cron`
items.notes: The official standard. Does not support steps (`/`) or month/day names.

items.name: cronie
items.notes: A fork of Vixie-cron. Supports nicknames and seconds.

items.name: vixie-cron / isc-cron
items.notes: The de facto standard for system cron.

items.name: dcron
items.notes: A simple and lightweight implementation that supports nicknames.

items.name: Spring Framework (`@Scheduled`)
items.notes: Supports seconds, `L`, `W`, `#`. Uses `AND` logic for date fields. `?` is a wildcard. No nicknames.

items.name: Quartz
items.notes: Original source for `L`, `W`, `#`. Does not allow combining dom ad dow, and but requires `?` to disambiguate date fields. No nicknames.

items.name: Cronos
items.notes: Supports seconds, nicknames, and advanced characters. Uses `AND` logic for date fields.

items.name: Coravel
items.notes: Provides basic cron string support but encourages a fluent API.

items.name: croner-rust
items.notes: Allows `?` as an alias for `*`.

items.name: cron
items.notes: Weekday numbering differs. Supports seconds but not nicknames or other extended features.

items.name: saffron
items.notes: Quartz-like, uses `AND` logic for date fields. Does not support seconds. Weekday numbering differs.

items.name: gocron (`robfig/cron`)
items.notes: Supports seconds & nicknames. `?` is alias for `*`. No `L`, `W`, `#`.

items.name: go-quartz
items.notes: Requiring `?` to disambiguate date fields. No nicknames.

items.name: croner (JS/TS)
items.notes: Defaults to OCPS `OR` logic. `W` is not supported. `?` is for substitution. Provides an optional `AND` mode.

items.name: node-schedule
items.notes: Supports seconds but not nicknames or other extended syntax.

items.name: node-cron
items.notes: Supports seconds.

items.name: cron (npm)
items.notes: Supports seconds.

items.name: cron-parser
items.notes: Supports seconds, `L`, `#`. `?` is alias for `*`. No `W` or nicknames.

items.name: dragonmantank/cron-expression
items.notes: A popular foundational library. Supports `L`, `W`, `#`, and nicknames. Does not support seconds.

items.name: python-crontab
items.notes: Designed to manage system crontabs. Supports nicknames. No advanced characters.

items.name: Sidekiq-Cron
items.notes: Supports seconds and natural language parsing via the Fugit gem. No support for `L`, `W`, `#`.
